messages.message: Would someone know how to force/manually running cypress tests during a Jenkins PR pipeline? Thanks :)

eg overriding some values in
```https://github.com/instabase/instabase/edit/epd_3496_revert_how_we_get_text_for_classification/.github/workflows/cypress.yml```
and then triggering rerun? :slightly_smiling_face:
I'm not entirely sure if this is right for what you're asking, but when I need to trigger a rerun for a PR I click the "Re-run all jobs" button here for the Cypress action

Ooh I bet it's because it doesn't pick up any tests that need to run since no frontend files were changed. What do you want to accomplish by running them on the PR? Your changes from the PR wouldn't be picked up since they're backend changes

Ah that's strange as this revert was due to reported cypress errors: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C029ZG026GZ/p1720624259754309 (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C029ZG026GZ/p1720624259754309)
Right, so this ran on aihub-sandbox.internal after your change was deployed. If you were to run it on this PR, it would still be running it with those backend changes deployed to the crafting sandbox

In the future for backend PRs we'd ideally be able to spin up a sandbox with those backend changes deployed to test them with crafting, but right now we can only test frontend changes with crafting. Our Cypress tests can catch backend errors only after those backend changes are deployed
Which is better than nothing at least!
